div.h3: For COVID-19 and Eatonville School District Updates - visit: ESD UPDATES

div.p: 100% of donations will be used to help students in need with items such as:
The purpose of this fundraiser is to reach students to keep them engaged in school and on track to graduate!
Eatonville School District partners with InvestED and our community to remove barriers for students.
The link will take you to the donation site: https://wa-eatonville-lite.intouchreceipting.com/communityfundraiser

p.a: District forms for Admissions and Release

table.style: border-collapse: collapse; border-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); width: 50%; margin: 0px auto;

td.em: Eatonville School District #404 does not discriminate in any programs or activities on the basis of sex, race, creed, religion, color, national origin, age, veteran or military status, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, disability, or the use of a trained dog guide or service animal and provides equal access to the Boy Scouts and other designated youth groups. The following employees have been designated to handle questions and complaints of alleged discrimination:

p.em: Address: 200 Lynch St. W., Eatonville, WA 98328; Telephone:
Title IX Coordinator, Section 504/ADA Coordinator & Civil Rights Compliance Coordinator:
Cristin Blaskowitz, Executive Student Services. Email:
